The discussion involves coordinating the response's timing and whether to involve the Office of Legislative Affairs.

events.title: Senate Letter to AG Barr Regarding Epstein Suicide
events.description: U.S. Senator Ben Sasse sends a letter to Attorney General William Barr containing questions (specifically Question 4 is referenced) about Jeffrey Epstein's suicide.

events.title: DOJ Internal Coordination on Senate Response
events.description: Internal DOJ email chain discussing the drafting of a response to Question 4 of Senator Sasse's letter about Epstein's suicide.

keyFacts: The U.S. Senate (specifically Senator Ben Sasse) sent a formal letter to Attorney General William Barr on August 10, 2019, with questions regarding Jeffrey Epstein's suicide.
U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman was tasked with providing a preliminary response to Question 4 of that Senate letter.

There was internal DOJ discussion about whether to involve the Office of Legislative Affairs (OLA) in drafting the response, with a preference to draft it 'conservatively' in accord with past guidance.
The email chain indicates a sense of urgency, with a desire to have a draft response completed on the same day (August 11, 2019).
